April 18, 1958
Dr. Harry J. Skornia
Executive Director, NAEB
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Harry
I have your letter of April 15th.
I am herewith enclosing a copy of my letter to Senator
Pastore requesting time for the presentation of our testi¬
mony.
The odds are that we will be called upon to testify on
either May 8 or 9.
I am leaving town next week and will be gone until May 5th.
I suggest that you proceed with the preparation of the factual
data. Once we have that, we can go ahead and prepare a draft
of the testimony itself. In essence, that testimony will
(a) give the Committee an insight into the problems which
would be created for some of our members if the legislation
were enacted and (b) then offer language which would specif¬
ically exempt educational institutions.
During my absence, please be in touch with Paul Dobin who is
thoroughly familiar with tb~
